367 public:
368  //
369  enum EOptType { OPT_NONE, OPT_BOOL_TRUE, OPT_BOOL_FALSE, OPT_INT, OPT_DOUBLE, OPT_STRING, OPT_ENUM_INT };
370  // RAB: 2003/10/10: Note: I had to move this out of the private section since
371  // the sun compiler (version 7) complained (rightly it now appears after looking
372  // up what the ISO/ANSI C++ standard says) about the declaration for opt_val_val_t
373  // not being able to access a private member of CommandLineProcessor.
374 
375 private:
376 
377  // /////////////////////////////////
378  // Private types
379 
380  // ToDo: RAB: 2004/05/25: Clean up these data structures and add
381  // support for a templated enum type. This will clean up usage
382  // quite a bit.
383 
384  //
385  struct opt_val_val_t {
386  opt_val_val_t()
387  :opt_type(OPT_NONE)
388  {}
389  opt_val_val_t( EOptType opt_type_in, const any& opt_val_in, bool required_in )
390  :opt_type(opt_type_in),opt_val(opt_val_in),required(required_in),was_read(false)
391  {}
392  EOptType opt_type;
393  any opt_val; // Will be bool*, int*, double*, std::string* or a small int (for OPT_ENUM_INT)
394  bool required;
395  bool was_read;
396  };
397 
398  //
399  typedef Teuchos::map<std::string,opt_val_val_t> options_list_t;
400 
401  //
402  struct opt_doc_t {
403  opt_doc_t()
404  :opt_type(OPT_NONE)
405  {}
406  opt_doc_t(EOptType opt_type_in, const std::string& opt_name_in, const std::string& opt_name_false_in
407  ,const std::string &documentation_in, const any &default_val_in )
408  :opt_type(opt_type_in),opt_name(opt_name_in),opt_name_false(opt_name_false_in)
409  ,documentation(documentation_in),default_val(default_val_in)
410  {}
411  EOptType opt_type;
412  std::string opt_name;
413  std::string opt_name_false; // only for bool
414  std::string documentation;
415  any default_val;
416  };
417 
418  //
419  typedef std::vector<opt_doc_t> options_documentation_list_t;
420 
421  //
422  struct enum_opt_data_t {
423  enum_opt_data_t()
424  :enum_option_val(NULL), num_enum_opt_values(0)
425  {}
426  enum_opt_data_t(
427  int *_enum_option_val
428  ,const int _num_enum_opt_values
429  ,const int _enum_opt_values[]
430  ,const char* _enum_opt_names[]
431  )
432  :enum_option_val(_enum_option_val)
433  ,num_enum_opt_values(_num_enum_opt_values)
434  ,enum_opt_values(_enum_opt_values,_enum_opt_values+_num_enum_opt_values)
435  {
436  for( int k = 0; k < num_enum_opt_values; ++k )
437  enum_opt_names.push_back(std::string(_enum_opt_names[k]));
438  }
439  int *enum_option_val;
440  int num_enum_opt_values;
441  std::vector<int> enum_opt_values;
442  std::vector<std::string> enum_opt_names;
443  };
444 
445  //
446  typedef std::vector<enum_opt_data_t> enum_opt_data_list_t;

585 
586 template <class EType>
587 inline
588 void CommandLineProcessor::setOption(
589  const char enum_option_name[]
590  ,EType *enum_option_val
591  ,const int num_enum_opt_values
592  ,const EType enum_opt_values[]
593  ,const char* enum_opt_names[]
594  ,const char documentation[]
595  ,const bool required
596  )
597 {
598  // RAB: 2004/05/25: Every C++ implementation that I know of just
599  // represents enumerations as int's and therefore this will compile
600  // just fine. However, the ISO/ANSI C++ standard says that
601  // compilers are allowed to use a smaller storage type for an enum
602  // but must not require storage any larger than an 'int'. If the
603  // below compile-time assertion does not compile then we need to do
604  // something different but it will be a lot of work!
605  CompileTimeAssert<sizeof(int)-sizeof(EType)>();
606  //CompileTimeAssert<sizeof(int)-sizeof(EType)-1>(); // Uncomment to see compilation error
607  setEnumOption(
608  enum_option_name
609  ,reinterpret_cast<int*>(enum_option_val)
610  ,num_enum_opt_values
611  ,reinterpret_cast<const int*>(enum_opt_values)
612  ,enum_opt_names
613  ,documentation
614  ,required
615  );
616 }
617 
618 inline
619 std::string CommandLineProcessor::opt_type_str( EOptType opt_type ) const
620 {
621  std::string str;
622  switch( opt_type ) {
623  case OPT_BOOL_TRUE:
624  str = "bool";
625  break;
626  case OPT_INT:
627  str = "int";
628  break;
629  case OPT_DOUBLE:
630  str = "double";
631  break;
632  case OPT_STRING:
633  str = "string";
634  break;
635  case OPT_ENUM_INT:
636  str = "enum";
637  break;
638  default:
639  assert(0); // Local programming error only
640  }
641  return str;
642 }
